tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE transaction_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    user_id INT,
    operation VARCHAR,
    details TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE transaction_logs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    transaction_type VARCHAR(50),
    amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE audit_trails (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT,
    event_type VARCHAR(50),
    event_description TEXT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE TransactionLog (
    transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    user_id INT,
    product_id INT,
    quantity INT
);

CREATE TABLE transactions (
 transaction_id VARCHAR(10),
 transaction_date TIMESTAMP,
 total_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
 customer_id VARCHAR(10),
 PRIMARY KEY (transaction_id)
)

CREATE TABLE order_details (
 order_id VARCHAR(10),
 product_id VARCHAR(10),
 quantity INT,
 price DECIMAL(8, 2),
 PRIMARY KEY (order_id, product_id)
)

CREATE TABLE audit_logs (
 log_id SERIAL,
 action_description TEXT,
 time_stamp TIMESTAMP,
 user_id VARCHAR(10),
 PRIMARY KEY (log_id)
)

CREATE TABLE users (
 user_id SERIAL,
 username VARCHAR(20),
 email VARCHAR(50),
 password_hash TEXT,
 PRIMARY KEY (user_id)
)

CREATE TABLE transaction_logs (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    transaction_type VARCHAR(50),
    amount DECIMAL(10,2),
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE audit_trails (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    action VARCHAR(50),
    user_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    details TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE users (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    username VARCHAR(50) UNIQUE,
    email VARCHAR(100),
    role VARCHAR(20),
    registered_at TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE products (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    name VARCHAR(100),
    price DECIMAL(10,2),
    category VARCHAR(50),
    stock_quantity INT
);

CREATE TABLE orders (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    product_id INT,
    quantity INT,
    order_date DATE
);
